goal.tools

Class UnitTestRun

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.AbstractRun<ObservableDebugger,UnitTestInterpreter<ObservableDebugger>>
      • goal.tools.UnitTestRun

  • public class UnitTestRun
extends AbstractRun<ObservableDebugger,UnitTestInterpreter<ObservableDebugger>>
    Runs a UnitTest program. During the test agent are created with a UnitTestInterpreter. This interpreter will execute a AgentTest provided by the UnitTest. The results can be collected by using the UnitTestRunResultInspector.
    Author:
    M.P. Korstanje

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class goal.tools.AbstractRun

    • Method Detail

      • awaitTermination

        protected void awaitTermination(RuntimeManager<? extends ObservableDebugger,? extends UnitTestInterpreter<ObservableDebugger>> runtimeManager)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Awaits termination using busy waiting. Checks if agents are running, if any dead agents failed their test and if timeout has passed. Note: Uses busy waiting, to do this with notifications is rather complex.
        Overrides:
        awaitTermination in class AbstractRun<ObservableDebugger,UnitTestInterpreter<ObservableDebugger>>
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • buildAgentFactory

        protected AgentFactory<ObservableDebugger,UnitTestInterpreter<ObservableDebugger>> buildAgentFactory(MessagingService messaging)
        Description copied from class: AbstractRun
        Provides an agent factory used to created agents by the run time. Subclasses can implement this method to provide their own agents.
        Specified by:
        buildAgentFactory in class AbstractRun<ObservableDebugger,UnitTestInterpreter<ObservableDebugger>>
        Parameters:
        messaging - the messaging service used for communication
        Returns:
        an agent factory
